frameDefinitions: This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
The words in this frame have to do with non-verbal communication.
An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability. '' 'Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny continued eating his lunch.'
This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings.
In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces.
A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.
frameExamples: Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
I <t>gestured</t> with my hand for him to come over.
Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny <t>continued</t> eating his lunch.
Let's hope it did n't have time to <t>communicate</t> any of its findings to its overlords.
listRoleDefinitions: One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
This is the sentient entity that communicates a Message non-verbally. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: <fex name='Communicator'>The teacher</fex> <t>gestured</t> us into the room.

This is the person to whom a non-verbal Message is communicated. It may be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement: The teacher <t>gestured</t> <fex name='Addressee'>us</fex> into the room. The teacher <t>gestured</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to us</fex> to enter the room.

This is the content of non-verbal communication. It may be expressed as a <ment>that</ment>-clause Complement, a <ment>to</ment>-marked infinitive VP Complement, or a directional PP Complement: The teacher <t>gestured</t> <fex name='Message'>that it was time to leave</fex>. The teacher <t>gestured</t> to us <fex name='Message'>to enter the room</fex>. The teacher <t>gestured</t> us <fex name='Message'>into the room</fex>.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific body part of the <fen>Communicator</fen> which gestures.
The <fen>Indicated_entity</fen> is the entity which the <fen>Communicator</fen> is pointing out to the <fen>Addressee</fen> as meaningful.
When the gesturing occus.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the gesturing occurs.

Duration denotes the length of <fen>Time</fen> from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
This role identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in (often unintentionally).
<fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels  or to a landmark past which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies before the Motion occurs.
The direction of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.  <fen>Direction</fen> characterizes the <fen>Path</fen> of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Motion occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where motion specified by <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> occurs.
The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
The location where the act of communication occurs.
listRoleExamples: She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
<fex>We</fex> have not yet acted .
Soot-contaminated snow falls <fex>in Slovakia's mountainous regions</fex>.
The rivals both fell backwards <fex>into empty space</fex>.
The boys plummeted <fex>down the stairs</fex> into the basement.
In 1977, <fex> Nigel</fex> plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
The man toppled <fex>from the passenger seat</fex> into the road.
I hope your egg does n't fall <fex>down</fex> .
<fex>In 1977</fex> Nigel plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex>, the towel dropped onto the floor.
<fex>He</fex> finds it hard to communicate with people, not least his separated parents .
How do you communicate to them <fex>that you really like them</fex> ?
Had someone communicated to the capital <fex>about the flagrant disregard of the religious law</fex> ?
Opinions are usually communicated <fex>over the telephone</fex> and are often given within 24 hours.
